sense.name: (The capacity of) speech.
sense.examples: Monkeys added their voices to the rainforest symphony. He lost his voice. A shrill voice sounded behind us.

sense.name: A sound suggestive of (but not actually) a vocal utterance.
sense.examples: The noisy voice of the waterfall drowned out our speech. We woke to the voices of the artillery.

sense.name: Expression in a coherent verbal form.
sense.examples: I gave voice to my feelings. She gave voice to our collective concerns.

sense.name: A means or agency by which something is communicated.
sense.examples: The Times is not the voice of New York. Conservatism has many voices. The meeting was attended by voices for all the organizations.

sense.name: The singing part or the melody carried by the singing part.
sense.examples: He wanted to hear trained voices sing it. He tried to sing the tenor voice. We need to find the best voice for this artist.

sense.name: (linguistics) the grammatical relation of the grammatical subject of a verb to the action the verb denotes.
sense.examples: Is it active or passive voice? Assign voice features to the following predicates.
